data.title: Nice and chill
data.text: I happened upon this restaurant because it appeared to very quiet, elegant and welcoming, and it worked for me, the ambience was quiet and serene although the place is big and busy, I sat at the bar and was waited on immediately,  the hostess Kim was warm and greeted me was a smile and carried on a conversation which was really nice after driving alone for a few hours. The bartender Sean was respectful and amicable not pushy but willing to have a talk despite how busy they were. It seems like a nice diverse place to come to regardless of the reason.

data.title: good food, excellent service
data.text: Café Navarre is located downtown in a 1920s bank building, a very attractive location.  The menu is varied, the food good and the service very good indeed.  The only problem is the noise level when there is a good crowd in certain locations where the ceiling is lower.

data.title: Wonderful food and delightful menu.
data.text: Every part of this restaurant is first rate. The bar area is airy and delightful. The booths and tables have a nice feeling also. Drinks and food couldn't be better. Try the mushroom soup.

data.title: Best food in SB hands down.
data.text: On regular visits I bounce around the top rated SB places, but when I really want a nice dinner, this is the place I find myself returning to.  Head and shoulders better cuisine than its neighbor also known for fine dining.  The food really is well thought out, creative, and would stand up against high quality restaurants in any major city.  This isn't just fine dining for a college town, it's fine dining, period.  On top the setting is superb inside a historic building with soaring ceilings over the dining room.  Service can't be beat, always great with a wine taste or food recommendation.

data.title: A True Culinary Delight
data.text: An upscale restaurant in the heart of downtown South Bend.  Unique appetizers and entrees, full wine list and micro beers on tap, an attentive wait staff, make this a true dining experience.  Come dine in an old bank building for a rich experience!

data.title: A Gem!
data.text: We came for a football weekend and tried Cafe Navarre.  So great! I've had duck all over the world and this was the best I've had.  It's a very happening place as well and the service was great.  Definitely worth the visit!

data.title: Consistent Great
data.text: This is one of my favorite places in South Bend.  I took my Belgian friend who is quite a food snob and he called it the best restaurant he has eaten at in all of Michiana.  The wine list, cocktails, presentation and interesting food choices will keep me returning regularly.  The bar up front is friendly and efficient with all sorts of excellent choices.  With quality comes cost but this place is definitely worth the trip if you are looking for a place worthy of Chicago or New York City.  It is downtown and parking is on one of the main streets which is pretty easy to accomplish.

data.title: Special birthday dinner
data.text: We were in town for the ND game and stayed Sunday. We were looking  for a great restaurant to celebrate my husband's birthday. Cafe Navarre lived up to its great reputation by outstanding waitstaff service and unbelievably delicious food. Great cocktail selection. I had the Shamrock Spritzer. Besides the salads, we tried the small plate of roasted cauliflower. Couldn't believe how good cauliflower could taste. I had the Rustic Shrimp in a perfectly flavored wine butter sauce while my husband had the flavorful Bison short ribs. Although we were filled we finished the meal by sharing the apple tart with delicious cappuccinos. Living in New York, we have been to many great restaurants and can say Cafe Navarre is as good as any of those BUT at a better price. Thank you Cafe Navarre for giving us a dinner we will never forget!

data.title: Always a good choice
data.text:
Cafe Navarre is a good choice for many reasons. In warm weather it is nice to be able to sit outside in an urban setting. The inside setting is  comfortable for special occasions, group dinners with friends, or dinner before downtown events.
The menu changes seasonally as well as being constantly tweaked by the chef. Very good choices. The servers are very knowledgeable about both food and wine offerings.

data.title: Cafe Complete.
data.text: Cafe Navarre includes a seasonally changing menu, to reflect what is fresh and available from locally sourced venues. Others will say this, and some succeed, as does Cafe Navarre. Comfortable price point, for the food, service and variety. Did I mention alfresco dining...if you hurry.

data.title: Exquisite food and comfortable atmosphere
data.text: This a restaurant that you can feel comfortable dressed up or in game attire after a ND game. And the food is Wonderful! From squash gnocchi to short ribs to filet mignon it's all wonderful! And don't forget the creme brûlée for desert!  This is a nice Gem in downtown South Bend Indiana!

data.title: Very nice white tablecloth restaurant in downtown South Bend
data.text:
Cafe Navarre offers a first class meal in a wonderful atmosphere.  White tablecloth dining at its finest.  I enjoyed the bass in a Japanese style preparation.  Housed in a grand old building, the atmosphere is great.  For a special meal. 

Beautiful bar area as well.

data.title: Very Good Food/Average Ambiance
data.text:
We ate at Café Navarre during Notre Dame's Freshman Welcome Weekend.  Not surprisingly the restaurant was full.  Even though we had made a reservation several weeks in advance through OpenTable, our party of four was seated in a back room on the second floor.  The room had no view of the lovely renovated bank interior and consisted of four white walls.  While the room might be appropriate for a private party, it really is not a substitute for the main floor dining or even the second floor dining that overlooks the main floor.

The food, as usual, was quite good, particularly the halibut special which was served in a Pan Asian broth.  Very light and refreshing on hot humid South Bend evening.  Still, however, given the price point and the complete lack of ambiance, the dinner was disappointing.

data.title: Met my expectations
data.text: As always, service and food was very good. The atmosphere is inviting. I normally choose this venue for entertaining clients or out of town guests for lunch. I highly recommend their mushroom soup, homemade chips, and lunch entree's.

data.title: Just Drinks Please!
data.text: Wife and I stopped by for a drink while frequenting the annual art fair.  Our bartender, Killian, was great as usual.  His parents just happened to come in and had some drinks as well.  It was an unexpected stop, we stayed for a second!

data.title: Expensive, and not worth it...
data.text:
We sat upstairs, not a prime seating location, the downstairs looks much more attractive.  I requested sitting in one of the 2 empty booths, but they were "reserved", although we did have a reservation.
2 of us had the fried green tomato salad, the slices were extremely thick, they should be thinly sliced, the cornbread crust was adequate but didn't compensate for the thickness of the tomato.  The sauce had a nice flavor, but there were 2 bits of  wilty lettuce draped on the top, I'm not sure what purpose that served, and looked odd.
The strip steak my son ordered Medium, came out rare, and as we were limited on time, decided not to send it back for correct cooking.  It should have come correctly cooked in the first place right?
My Shrimp Scampi, had 6 shrimp, and a completely flavorless sauce, little garlic flavor, little flavor altogether.  Shrimp Scampi should be robust!
The Chicken dish seemed ok, but was dry-overcooked.
The service was good, but given the dissappointing food, we won't be back.
Sorry to say that as there is limited good dining in Southbend.

data.title: Delightful
data.text: Enjoyed the old bank building with a new and tasty fare. Very upscale delicious small portions. Extensive wine list, wonderful choices by the glass. Fresh catch of the day was perfect.

user_location.name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee

data.title: Favorite STSB establishment!
data.text: This is an old bank that has been beautifully renovated to an upscale restaurant with a menu that gets changed up often enough that you don't get bored with the fare.  My husband raves about the mushroom soup and I always find a red meat option that makes my taste buds happy!

data.title: Very good restaurant on the "pricey" side
data.text: All meals and drinks were very good. Service and atmosphere as well. Not the most expensive restaurant in the area, but still on the higher priced end. Overall, I would recommend Café Navarre.

data.title: Great vegan offerings
data.text: Visited here with friends from out of town delicious vegan quinoa in squash friends had duck and also great reports on those plates
